title: Visual Studio 2022
description: Installs Visual Studio 2022. If Community edition, no need for a product key. If no key is provided, the product provides a 30 day trial.  You can switch from trial to licensed at any time using your product key or by entering your VS account credentials.

edition.description: Visual Studio Edition (Enterprise, Professional or Community)

aspnet.description: Tools for developing ASP.NET and Web applications including IIS Express, Web Deploy, and SQL Server LocalDB.

netcore.description: Build cross-platform applications using .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, HTML, JavaScript, and container development tools.

desktop.description: Build WPF, Windows Forms and console applications using the .NET Framework.

azure.description: Azure SDK, tools, and projects for developing cloud apps and creating resources.

data.description: Connect, develop and test data solutions using SQL Server, Azure Data Lake, Hadoop or Azure ML.

node.description: Build scalable network applications using Node.js, an asynchronous event-driven JavaScript runtime.

languages.description: You can specify multiple languages using a comma-separated list (,). Available values are cs-CZ,de-DE,en-US,es-ES,fr-FR,it-IT,ja-JP,ko-KR,pl-PL,pt-BR,ru-RU,tr-TR,zh-CN,zh-TW.

key.description: Visual Studio key in the format aaaaa-bbbbb-ccccc-ddddd-eeeee. Leave empty for 30 day trial.

runCommand.commandToExecute: [concat('powerShell.exe -ExecutionPolicy bypass " & ''.\vs2022.ps1'' -edition ', parameters('edition'), ' -preview:$', parameters('preview'), ' -aspnet:$',  parameters('aspnet'), ' -netcore:$',  parameters('netcore'), ' -desktop:$',  parameters('desktop'), ' -azure:$', parameters('azure'), ' -data:$', parameters('data'), ' -node:$', parameters('node'),  ' -languages ''' , parameters('languages')    ,'''  -key ''', parameters('key'), ''' "'  )]
